questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of graph in computer science?

explanations.a: An undirected graph is graph, i.e., a set of objects (called vertices or nodes) that are connected together, where all the edges are bidirectional
explanations.b: bar graph is a chart that presents categorical data with rectangular bars
explanations.c: A directed graph, also called a digraph, is a graph in which the edges have a direction
explanations.d: A weighted graph is a graph in which each branch is given a numerical weight

questions.question: What is vertex coloring of a graph?

answers.a: A condition where any two vertices having a common edge should not have same color
answers.b: A condition where any two vertices having a common edge should always have same color
answers.c: A condition where all vertices should have a different color
answers.d: A condition where all vertices should have same color

explanations.a: The condition for vertex coloring of a graph is that two vertices which share a common edge should not have the same color. If it uses k colors in the process then it is called k coloring of graph

questions.question: In a properly vertex-coloured graph, what can you say about the colours of connected vertices (vertices with an edge between them)?

answers.a: They must all have the same colour
answers.b: They must all have different colours

questions.question: A graph G has a chromatic number of 2. What can you conclude about G?

answers.c: G can only be coloured with exactly 2 colours.
answers.d: G must have an even number of vertices.

explanations.b: (Since the chromatic number is 2, it can be properly coloured with just 2 colours, which is a characteristic of bipartite graphs)

questions.question: A friend claims they coloured a graph with 10 vertices and only needed 1 colour.  Is this possible?

answers.a: No, this is not possible for any graph with more than 1 vertex
answers.b: Yes, it's always possible to colour any graph with just 1 colour
answers.c: It depends on the specific connections in the graph

explanations.a: Since vertices can be connected, you'll always need at least 2 colours to avoid colouring connected vertices the same
